conclusion: Objects A and B are positioned above objects C, D, E, and F.
Objects A and B move downward due to gravity and come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F.
Upon contact, objects A and B are placed down at the locations of objects C, D, E, and F.
After being placed, the cloths (A and B) drape over the blocks (C, D, E, F), causing them to sag in the middle.
The cloths hang down due to the weight of the blocks underneath, creating a noticeable dip in the middle.
The images illustrate the sequence where the cloths sag as they cover the blocks, confirming the effect of gravity and the weight distribution.
The cloths will sag in the middle due to the weight of the blocks underneath, as shown in the final image.
